page.title: 10Fashion, Warbleton
page.content: On a bus sat a girl. She wore a shirt with sleeves rolled up and the tails hanging out over her tight fitting trousers which left her ankles bare. Her feet were in flat pale blue slippers with long criss-cross laces tied round her ankles. Her hair was tinted blond, cut very short and brushed close to her head each side. She wore little or no make-up. Her companion had dark curls falling on his shoulders. He wore very old jeans and a loose faded jersey. At a funeral service, the congregation were mostly elderly women. Most of them had their hair cut short enough to be set in small curls and waves. Only three wore hats, one being the widow. Some had thin scarves over their heads. In the country, fur and tweed coats are rare as nearly everyone has a padded nylon wind-proof jacket often with a hood.
